### collectBitParts() {#aa16fecc86f9853cc81abd01a5a6f1604}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static const std::optional&lt; BitPart &gt; &amp; collectBitParts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, bool MatchBSwaps, bool MatchBitReversals, std::map&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, std::optional&lt; BitPart &gt; &gt; &amp; BPS, int Depth, bool &amp; FoundRoot)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Analyze the specified subexpression and see if it is capable of providing pieces of a bswap or bitreverse.

The subexpression provides a potential piece of a bswap or bitreverse if it can be proved that each non-zero bit in the output of the expression came from a corresponding bit in some other value. This function is recursive, and the end result is a mapping of bitnumber to bitnumber. It is the caller&#39;s responsibility to validate that the bitnumber to bitnumber mapping is correct for a bswap or bitreverse.

For example, if the current subexpression if &quot;(shl i32 %X, 24)&quot; then we know that the expression deposits the low byte of X into the high byte of the result and that all other bits are zero. This expression is accepted and a <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-local-cpp-/bitpart">BitPart</a> is returned with Provider set to X and Provenance&#91;24-31&#93; set to &#91;0-7&#93;.

For vector types, all analysis is performed at the per-element level. No cross-element analysis is supported (shuffle/insertion/reduction), and all constant masks must be splatted across all elements.

To avoid revisiting values, the <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-local-cpp-/bitpart">BitPart</a> results are memoized into the provided map. To avoid unnecessary copying of BitParts, BitParts are constructed in-place in the <code>BPS</code> map. Because of this <code>BPS</code> needs to store BitParts objects, not pointers. As we need the concept of a nullptr BitParts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> has been analyzed and the analysis failed), we an Optional type instead to provide the same functionality.

Because we pass around references into <code>BPS</code>, we must use a container that does not invalidate internal references (std::map instead of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>).

Definition at line <a href="#l03849">3849</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/local-cpp">Local.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if a bitcast between a value of type <code>FromTy</code> to type <code>ToTy</code> would losslessly preserve the bits and semantics of the value.

This predicate is symmetric, i.e swapping <code>FromTy</code> and <code>ToTy</code> should give the same result.

Note that Type::canLosslesslyBitCastTo is not suitable here because it allows semantically unequivalent bitcasts, such as &lt;2 x i64&gt; -&gt; &lt;4 x i32&gt;, and also does not allow lossless pointer &lt;-&gt; integer conversions.

<Link id="l03832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3832"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// BitPart is returned with Provider set to %X and Provenance&#91;24-31&#93; set to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3834"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
